papers.title: Tweet Based Reach Aware Temporal Attention Network for NFT Valuation
papers.venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
papers.authors: Ramit Sawhney,Megh Thakkar,R. Soun,A. Neerkaje,Vasu Sharma,Dipanwita Guhathakurta,S. Chava
papers.summary: This work proposes a novel reach-aware temporal learning approach to make predictions for forecasting future trends in the NFT market that outperforms other state-of-the-art methods by an average of 36%.

papers.title: Modeling financial uncertainty with multivariate temporal entropy-based curriculums
papers.venue: Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence
papers.authors: Ramit Sawhney,Arnav Wadhwa,Ayush Mangal,V. Mittal,Shivam Agarwal,R. Shah
papers.summary: This work proposes a novel multi-modal curriculum learning approach, FinCLASS, which evaluates stock affecting signals via entropy-based heuristics and measures their linguistic and price-based complexities in a time-aware, hierarchical fashion and shows how FinCLASS out-performs state-of-the-art across stock movement prediction, volatility regression, and proÔ¨Åt generation.

papers.title: FAST: Financial News and Tweet Based Time Aware Network for Stock Trading
papers.venue: Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.summary: This work proposes a novel hierarchical, learning to rank approach that uses textual data to make time-aware predictions for ranking stocks based on expected profit and outperforms state-of-the-art methods by over 8% in terms of cumulative profit and risk-adjusted returns.

papers.title: Fundamental Analysis based Neural Network for Stock Movement Prediction
papers.venue: China National Conference on Chinese Computational Linguistics
papers.summary: A fundamental analysis based neural network for stock movement prediction that introduces a coattention mechanism to capture the sufficient context information between text and prices across every day within a time window and obtains more sufficient stock representation.

papers.title: Hybrid Information Mixing Module for Stock Movement Prediction
papers.summary: A multilayer perceptron-based model, the hybrid information mixing module, is applied to the stock price movement prediction to conduct a price fluctuation prediction experiment in a stock market with high volatility.

papers.title: Exploring the Scale-Free Nature of Stock Markets: Hyperbolic Graph Learning for Algorithmic Trading
papers.summary: HyperStockGAT is proposed, the first model on the Riemannian Manifolds for stock selection and significantly outperforms state-of-the-art stock forecasting methods in terms of profitability by over 12%, and risk-adjusted Sharpe Ratio by over 4%.

papers.title: A hybrid approach for stock trend prediction based on tweets embedding and historical prices
papers.summary: A hybrid approach for stock market prediction based on tweets embedding and historical prices is proposed, which takes the internal semantic features and external structural characteristics of Twitter data into account, such that the generated tweet vectors can contain more effective information.

papers.title: Quantitative Day Trading from Natural Language using Reinforcement Learning
papers.venue: North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.summary: This work proposes a deep reinforcement learning approach that makes time-aware decisions to trade stocks while optimizing profit using textual data and outperforms state-of-the-art in terms of risk-adjusted returns in trading simulations on two benchmarks.

papers.title: Hyperbolic Online Time Stream Modeling
papers.venue: Annual International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval
papers.authors: Ramit Sawhney,Shivam Agarwal,Megh Thakkar,Arnav Wadhwa,R. Shah
papers.summary: This work proposes the first Hierarchical Time-Aware Hyperbolic LSTM, which leverages the Riemannian manifold for encoding the scale-free nature of a sequence of text in a time-aware fashion, and demonstrates HTLSTM's applicability for modeling temporal sequences of online information.

papers.title: Graph-Based Learning for Stock Movement Prediction with Textual and Relational Data
papers.venue: International Conference on AI in Finance
papers.summary: A new stock movement prediction framework is proposed: multigraph recurrent network for stock forecasting (MGRN), which allows combining the textual sentiment from financial news and multiple relational information extracted from other types of financial data.

papers.title: Stock Movement Prediction Based on Bi-Typed Hybrid-Relational Market Knowledge Graph via Dual Attention Networks
papers.venue: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering
papers.authors: Yu Zhao,Huaming Du,Ying Liu,Shaopeng Wei,Xingyan Chen,Fuzhen Zhuang,Qing Li,Ji Liu,Gang Kou
papers.summary: The proposed DanSmp, a novel Dual Attention Networks to learn the momentum spillover signals based upon the constructed MKG for stock prediction is proposed and demonstrated to be capable of improving stock prediction with the constructedMKG.

papers.title: Quantitative Stock Investment by Routing Uncertainty-Aware Trading Experts: A Multi-Task Learning Approach
papers.summary: AlphaMix is a novel two-stage mixture-of-experts (MoE) framework for quantitative investment to mimic the efficient bottom-up trading strategy design workflow of successful trading firms and is a universal framework that is applicable to various backbone network architectures with consistent performance gains.

papers.title: Heterogeneous Interactive Snapshot Network for Review-Enhanced Stock Profiling and Recommendation
papers.venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence
papers.authors: Heyuan Wang,Tengjiao Wang,Shun Li,Shijie Guan,Jiayi Zheng,Wei Chen
papers.summary: This paper proposes a novel heterogeneous interactive snapshot network for stock profiling and recommendation, and introduces a novel twins-GRU method, which tightly couples the media and price parallel sequences in a cross-interactive fashion to catch dynamic dependencies between successive snapshots.

papers.title: Stock Market Prediction via Deep Learning Techniques: A Survey
papers.authors: Jinan Zou,Qi Zhao,Yang Jiao,Hai Cao,Yanxi Liu,Qingsen Yan,Ehsan Abbasnejad,Lingqiao Liu,Javen Qinfeng Shi
papers.summary: A novel taxonomy is proposed to summarize the state-of-the-art models based on deep neural networks in stock market prediction and detailed statistics on the datasets and evaluation metrics commonly used in the stock market are provided.

papers.title: StockEmotions: Discover Investor Emotions for Financial Sentiment Analysis and Multivariate Time Series
papers.authors: Jean Lee,Hoyoul Luis Youn,Josiah Poon,S. Han
papers.summary: This paper introduces StockEmotions, a new dataset for detecting emotions in the stock market that consists of 10,000 English comments collected from StockTwits, a financial social media platform, Inspired by behavioral finance.

papers.title: Mastering Stock Markets with Efficient Mixture of Diversified Trading Experts
papers.authors: Shuo Sun,Xinrun Wang,Wanqi Xue,Xiaoxuan Lou,Bo An
papers.summary: This work proposes AlphaMix, a novel three-stage mixture-of-experts (MoE) framework for quantitative investment to mimic the efficient bottom-up hierarchical trading strategy design workflow of successful trading companies and demonstrates that AlphaMix significantly outperforms many state-of theart baselines in terms of 7 popular financial criteria.

papers.title: Diffusion Variational Autoencoder for Tackling Stochasticity in Multi-Step Regression Stock Price Prediction
papers.venue: International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management
papers.authors: Kelvin J.L. Koa,Yunshan Ma,Ritchie Ng,Tat-Seng Chua
papers.summary: The Diffusion-VAE (D-Va) model is shown to outperform state-of-the-art solutions in terms of its prediction accuracy and variance and how each of the components introduced helps to improve overall prediction accuracy by reducing the data noise.

papers.title: Media Moments and Corporate Connections: A Deep Learning Approach to Stock Movement Classification
papers.summary: This work introduces a method that combines financial data, social media, and correlated stock relationships via a graph neural network in a hierarchical temporal fashion and provides empirical evidence of the tool's applicability for use in investment decisions.

papers.title: Stock Price Movement Prediction based on Relation Type guided Graph Convolutional Network
aiai at the NTCIR-14 FinNum Task : Financial Numeral Tweets Fine-Grained Classification Using Deep Word and Character Embedding-Based Attention Model
papers.summary: The deep word and character embedding-based attention model is proposed to fine-grained classify the financial numeral tweets and has good performance.

papers.title: Investigating the Impact of Public Mood in the Stock Market
papers.authors: Lorenzo Malandri,Frank Xing,C. Orsenigo,C. Vercellis,E. Cambria
papers.summary: The overall purpose of this thesis is to study the correlation between scattered public mood and financial markets, and presents a solution to three classical problems of applied finance: the portfolio allocation problem, the formalization of market views and the use of mixed methods for stock returns prediction.

papers.title: Transformer-Based Capsule Network For Stock Movement Prediction
papers.authors: Jintao Liu,Hongfei Lin,Xikai Liu,Bo Xu,Yuqi Ren,Yufeng Diao,Liang Yang
papers.summary: A CapTE (Capsule network based on Transformer Encoder) model which uses the Trans transformer Encoder to extract the deep semantic features of the social media and then captures the structural relationship of the texts through a capsule network is proposed.

papers.title: EMNLP-IJCNLP 2019 ECONLP ‚Äî Economics and Natural Language Processing Proceedings of the Second Workshop on Economics and Natural Language Processing (ECONLP 2019)
papers.summary: This talk covers use-cases of NLP to aid in regulatory workflows: from processing to risk assessment and surveillance, and shortcomings of current NLP technologies for financial regulation, and areas for future research and improvement.

papers.title: Stock Trend Prediction using Financial Market News and BERT
papers.venue: International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Information Retrieval
papers.summary: This paper applies the popular BERT model to leverage financial market news to predict stock price movements and shows that the proposed methods are simple but very effective, which can significantly improve the stock prediction accuracy on a standard financial database over the baseline system and existing work.

papers.title: Machine Learning for Financial Risk Management: A Survey
papers.summary: A taxonomy of financial-risk-management tasks and connect them with relevant machine learning methods is presented, and major challenges being faced by researchers in this area are identified.

papers.title: Stock Market Analysis with Text Data: A Review
papers.summary: The aim of this study is to survey the main stock market analysis models, text representation techniques for financial market prediction, shortcomings of existing techniques, and propose promising directions for future research.

papers.title: FinTech Applications
papers.venue: From Opinion Mining to Financial Argument Mining
papers.summary: It is shown that financial opinion mining is useful and crucial in many financial application scenarios and can be applied to many listed services.

papers.title: Improving the Prediction of Cryptocurrencies Movement Using Adversarial Training
Dynamic Graph Transformer for Implicit Tag Recognition
papers.venue: Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.summary: This work presents a novel dynamic graph transformer that distills the textual information and the entity relations on the fly and confirms the effectiveness of the approach to implicit tag recognition.

papers.title: One Step Ahead: A Framework for Detecting Unexpected Incidents and Predicting the Stock Markets
papers.summary: A framework that extracts incident facts globally based on a deep neural network, feeds them into models built on a global event database complemented with novel socioeconomic datasets, and predicts stock market directions in a simulated real-world setting with interpretable results that outperform various baselines is built.

papers.title: IMPROVED STOCK PRICE MOVEMENT CLASSIFICATION USING NEWS ARTICLES BASED ON EMBEDDINGS AND LABEL SMOOTHING
papers.summary: This paper proposes to improve stock price movement classification using news articles by incorporating regularization and optimization techniques from deep learning, and captures the dependencies between news articles and stocks through embeddings and bidirectional recurrent neural networks as in recent models.

papers.title: Research on stock prediction algorithm based on CNN and LSTM
papers.venue: Academic Journal of Computing & Information Science
papers.summary: The proposed model uses the convolution idea of CNN to construct feature extraction layer to extract features, and inputs the extracted features into LSTM, to study the temporal message of the features better and is effective in reducing forecasting errors.

papers.title: DeepScalper: A Risk-Aware Deep Reinforcement Learning Framework for Intraday Trading with Micro-level Market Embedding
papers.authors: Shuo Sun,Rundong Wang,Xu He,Junlei Zhu,Jian Li,Bo An
papers.summary: DeepScalper is proposed, a deep reinforcement learning framework for intraday trading that adopts an encoder-decoder architecture to learn robust market embedding incorporating both macro-level and micro-level market information and proposes a risk-aware auxiliary task by predicting future volatility.

papers.title: HYPHEN: Hyperbolic Hawkes Attention For Text Streams
papers.venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.authors: Shivam Agarwal,Ramit Sawhney,S. Ahuja,R. Soun,S. Chava
papers.summary: A Hyperbolic Hawkes Attention Network (HYPHEN), which learns a data-driven hyperbolic space and models irregular powerlaw excitations using a hyperbolics Hawkes process, and its practical applicability for modeling online text sequences in a geometry agnostic manner is demonstrated.

papers.title: HADAPS: Hierarchical Adaptive Multi-Asset Portfolio Selection
papers.summary: Qualitative analysis shows HADAPS ‚Äô ability to adaptively shift portfolio selection strategies in dynamic market conditions where asset classes and different assets are uncorrelated to each other.

papers.title: Causality-Guided Multi-Memory Interaction Network for Multivariate Stock Price Movement Prediction
papers.venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.authors: Di Luo,Weiheng Liao,Shuqi Li,Xin Cheng,Rui Yan
papers.summary: The proposed Causality-guided Multi-memory Interaction Network (CMIN), a novel end-to-end deep neural network for stock movement prediction which, for the first time, models the multi-modality between financial text data and causality-enhanced stock correlations to achieve higher prediction accuracy.

papers.title: Predicting short-term Bitcoin price fluctuations from buy and sell orders
papers.summary: A generative temporal mixture model of the volatility and trade order book data is constructed, which is able to out-perform the current state-of-the-art machine learning and time-series statistical models.

papers.title: Bitcoin Volatility Forecasting with a Glimpse into Buy and Sell Orders
papers.summary: This paper proposes temporal mixture models capable of adaptively exploiting both volatility history and order book features, and demonstrates the prospect of the temporal mixture model as an interpretable forecasting framework over heterogeneous Bitcoin data.

papers.title: Improving Stock Movement Prediction with Adversarial Training
papers.authors: Fuli Feng,Huimin Chen,Xiangnan He,Ji Ding,Maosong Sun,Tat-Seng Chua
papers.summary: A new machine learning solution for stock movement prediction, which aims to predict whether the price of a stock will be up or down in the near future, is added to simulate the stochasticity of continuous price variable, and train the model to work well under small yet intentional perturbations.

papers.title: Enhancing Stock Movement Prediction with Adversarial Training
papers.venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence
papers.authors: Fuli Feng,Huimin Chen,Xiangnan He,Ji Ding,Maosong Sun,Tat-Seng Chua
papers.summary: A new machine learning solution for stock movement prediction, which aims to predict whether the price of a stock will be up or down in the near future, is added to simulate the stochasticity of price variable, and train the model to work well under small yet intentional perturbations.

papers.title: Ensemble of Technical Analysis and Machine Learning for Market Trend Prediction
papers.venue: IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence
papers.authors: Andrea Picasso Ratto,Simone Merello,L. Oneto,Yukun Ma,Lorenzo Malandri,E. Cambria
papers.summary: A new approach that leverages technical analysis to predict market directional movements is proposed, which aims to predict the directional movement of the NASDAQ‚Äôs most capitalized stocks by solving a classification problem.

papers.title: Investigating Timing and Impact of News on the Stock Market
papers.venue: 2018 IEEE International Conference on Data Mining Workshops (ICDMW)
papers.authors: Simone Merello,Andrea Picasso Ratto,Yukun Ma,L. Oneto,E. Cambria
papers.summary: Results on US market show that the information contained in news can be used as an accurate predictor for past price movements, when the future is considered, however, the correlation between news and stock market becomes less clear.

papers.title: Knowledge-Driven Stock Trend Prediction and Explanation via Temporal Convolutional Network
papers.authors: Shumin Deng,Ningyu Zhang,Wen Zhang,Jiaoyan Chen,Jeff Z. Pan,Huajun Chen
papers.summary: A novel Knowledge-Driven Temporal Convolutional Network is proposed for stock trend prediction and explanation that can react to abrupt changes much faster and outperform state-of-the-art methods on stock datasets, as well as facilitate the explanation of prediction particularly with abrupt changes.

papers.title: Ensemble Application of Transfer Learning and Sample Weighting for Stock Market Prediction
papers.venue: IEEE International Joint Conference on Neural Network
papers.authors: Simone Merello,Andrea Picasso Ratto,L. Oneto,E. Cambria
papers.summary: Results on a real simulation of trading show how the problem of stock market forecasting is formulated as regression of market returns can be used to invest in high performing stocks and achieve higher profits with less trades.

papers.title: AlphaStock: A Buying-Winners-and-Selling-Losers Investment Strategy using Interpretable Deep Reinforcement Attention Networks
papers.authors: Jingyuan Wang,Yang Zhang,Ke Tang,Junjie Wu,Zhang Xiong
papers.summary: It turns out that AlphaStock tends to select the stocks as winners with high long-term growth, low volatility, high intrinsic value, and being undervalued recently.

papers.title: Group, Extract and Aggregate: Summarizing a Large Amount of Finance News for Forex Movement Prediction
papers.venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
papers.authors: Deli Chen,Shuming Ma,Keiko Harimoto,Ruihan Bao,Qi Su,Xu Sun
papers.summary: This work proposes a BERT-based Hierarchical Aggregation Model to summarize a large amount of finance news to predict forex movement and shows that the category based method performs best among three grouping methods and outperforms all the baselines.

papers.title: Incorporating Fine-grained Events in Stock Movement Prediction
papers.venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
papers.authors: Deli Chen,Yanyan Zou,Keiko Harimoto,Ruihan Bao,Xuancheng Ren,Xu Sun
papers.summary: This work proposes a professional finance event dictionary built by domain experts and uses it to extract fine-grained events automatically from finance news, and designs a neural model to combine finance news with fine- grained event structure and stock trade data to predict the stock movement.

papers.title: Technical analysis and sentiment embeddings for market trend prediction
papers.authors: Andrea Picasso Ratto,Simone Merello,Yukun Ma,Luca Oneto,Erik Cambria
papers.summary: This work aims to combine both technical and fundamental analysis through the application of data science and machine learning techniques and produces a robust predictive model able to forecast the trend of a portfolio composed by the twenty most capitalized companies listed in the NASDAQ100 index.

papers.title: A Divide-and-Conquer Framework for Attention-based Combination of Multiple Investment Strategies
papers.venue: IEEE Global Conference on Signal and Information Processing
papers.authors: Xiao Yang,Weiqing Liu,Lewen Wang,Cheng Qu,Jiang Bian
papers.summary: A 2D-attention framework to capture the dynamics of the above two factors, which categorizes the whole market periods into a few stable states and jointly learn respective models for each state and build a state-wise attention model to combine them dynamically for the final task.

papers.title: Learning to Fuse Multiple Semantic Aspects from Rich Texts for Stock Price Prediction
papers.summary: Experimental results on real data sets show the superior performance of MAFN against several strong baselines as well as the effectiveness of exploiting and fusing fine-grained aspect-level textual information for stock price prediction.

papers.title: Applications of deep learning in stock market prediction: recent progress
papers.summary: A review of recent works on deep learning models for stock market prediction by category the different data sources, various neural network structures, and common used evaluation metrics to help the interested researchers to synchronize with the latest progress and also help them to easily reproduce the previous studies as baselines.

papers.title: NLP in FinTech Applications: Past, Present and Future
papers.summary: This position paper focuses on the researches applying natural language processing (NLP) technologies in the finance domain and outlines the application scenarios from three aspects including Know Your Customer (KYC), Know Your Product (KYP), and Satisfy Your customer (SYC).

papers.title: Fine-grained Financial Opinion Mining: A Survey and Research Agenda
papers.summary: A road map of fine-grained financial opinion mining is proposed for future researches, and several challenges yet to explore are pointed out.

papers.title: Multi-Graph Convolutional Network for Relationship-Driven Stock Movement Prediction
papers.summary: A deep learning framework, called Multi-GCGRU, which comprises graph convolutional network (GCN) and gated recurrent unit (GRU) to predict stock movement, which is feasible to incorporate more effective stock relationships containing expert knowledge, as well as learn data-driven relationship.

papers.title: ND-SMPF: A Noisy Deep Neural Network Fusion Framework for Stock Price Movement Prediction
papers.summary: The proposed ND-SMPF predictive framework uses information fusion to combine twitter data with extended horizon market historical prices to boost the accuracy of the stock movement prediction task.

papers.title: Stock Embeddings Acquired from News Articles and Price History, and an Application to Portfolio Optimization
papers.venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.summary: The results of portfolio optimization using Reuters & Bloomberg headlines, producing a capital gain 2.8 times larger than that obtained with a baseline method using only stock price data suggests that the proposed stock embedding can leverage textual financial semantics to solve financial prediction problems.

papers.title: Stock Index Prediction with Multi-task Learning and Word Polarity Over Time
papers.summary: A two-stage system that consists of a sentiment extractor to extract the opinion on the market trend and a summarizer that predicts the direction of the index movement of following week given the opinions of the news over the current week is proposed.

papers.title: Towards Earnings Call and Stock Price Movement
papers.summary: This work proposes to model the language in transcripts using a deep learning framework, where an attention mechanism is applied to encode the text data into vectors for the discriminative network classifier to predict stock price movements.

papers.title: Multimodal Multi-Task Financial Risk Forecasting
papers.authors: Ramit Sawhney,Puneet Mathur,Ayush Mangal,Piyush Khanna,R. Shah,Roger Zimmermann
papers.summary: This work presents a multi-task solution that utilizes domain specialized textual features and audio attentive alignment for predictive financial risk and price modeling and shows the effectiveness of the deep multimodal approach.

papers.title: Connecting the dots: forecasting and explaining short-term market volatility

papers.summary: This work proposes news-powered neural models to forecast short-term volatility and presents a soft-constrained dynamic beam allocation algorithm to control the state-of-the-art language model (GPT-2) to generate fluent and informative explanations.

papers.title: Utilization of deep learning to mine insights from earning calls for stock price movement predictions
papers.venue: International Conference on AI in Finance
papers.summary: This work uses earning call transcripts combined with companies' historical stock data and sector information to predict company's stock price movements and proposes a deep learning framework jointly, where attention mechanism is applied to the earnings call textual feature and a recurrent neural network is used on the sequential stock price data.

papers.title: Market volatility prediction based on long- and short-term memory retrieval architectures
papers.venue: International Conference on AI in Finance
papers.summary: A new deep neural network-based architecture named Long- and Short-term Memory Retrieval (LSMR) architecture to forecast short-term and mid-term volatility and demonstrates the superior performance of the proposed models in predicting highly volatile scenarios, compared to existing methods in the literature.

papers.title: Spatiotemporal Hypergraph Convolution Network for Stock Movement Forecasting
papers.summary: STHGCN significantly outperforms state-of-the-art stock forecasting methods over extensive experiments on long term realworld S&P500 index data of stocks traded in the NASDAQ and NYSE markets over 12 diverse phases and proposes a novel architecture for stock trend forecasting that can be applied across various problems in the spatiotemporal domain.

papers.title: Enhancing Stock Trend Prediction Models by Mining Relational Graphs of Stock Prices
papers.venue: 2020 International Conference on Pervasive Artificial Intelligence (ICPAI)
papers.summary: The proposed RGStocknet (Relational Graph Stock Enhancing Network) framework is proposed that can boost performance on an arbitrary time series prediction backbone model and carry the potential to incorporate relations with external resources to achieve higher performance further.

papers.title: Stock Movement Classification from Twitter via Mogrifier Based Memory Cells with Attention Mechanism
papers.venue: International Conferences on Information Technologies and Electrical Engineering
papers.summary: Experiment on real-world stock market data shows the Mogrifier based cell can outperform the venerable ones across different market sectors while still achieves lower prediction volatility.

papers.title: ADD: Augmented Disentanglement Distillation Framework for Improving Stock Trend Forecasting
papers.summary: This paper introduces an augmented Disentanglement Distillation approach to remove interferential features from the noised raw data to avoid the two factors disturbing each other's own prediction.

papers.title: COVID19-HPSMP: COVID-19 adopted Hybrid and Parallel deep information fusion framework for stock price movement prediction
papers.summary: A novel hybrid and parallel DNN-based framework is proposed that integrates different and diversified learning architectures and innovative fusion strategies are used to combine scattered social media news related to COVID-19 with historical mark data.

papers.title: REST: Relational Event-driven Stock Trend Forecasting
papers.authors: W. Xu,Weiqing Liu,Chang Xu,Jiang Bian,Jian Yin,Tie-Yan Liu
papers.summary: This paper proposes a relational event-driven stock trend forecasting (REST) framework, which can address the shortcoming of existing methods and construct a stock graph and design a new propagation layer to propagate the effect of event information from related stocks.

papers.title: FinSense: An Assistant System for Financial Journalists and Investors
papers.authors: Yi-Ting Liou,Chung-Chi Chen,Tsun-Hsien Tang,Hen-Hsen Huang,Hsin-Hsi Chen
papers.summary: Given the draft of a financial news story, FinSense extracts the explicit-mentioned stocks and further infers the implicit stocks, providing insightful information for decision making and proposes a novel graph convolutional network model that performs implicit financial instrument inference toward the in-domain data.

papers.title: Recurrent dictionary learning for state-space models with an application in stock forecasting
papers.summary: Comment on the translational aspect of the work presented in the paper and its potential clinical impact and detailed discussion of these aspects should be provided in the main body of the paper.

papers.title: A New Strategy for Short-Term Stock Investment Using Bayesian Approach
papers.summary: This paper transforms the daily stock price time series object into a data frame format where the dependent variable is the stock trend label and the independent variables are the stock variations of the last few days and proposes a new method for stock selection and a new stock trading strategy.

papers.title: A New Strategy for Short-Term Stock Investment Using Bayesian Approach
papers.summary: This paper transforms the daily stock price time series object into a data frame format where the dependent variable is the stock trend label and the independent variables are the stock variations of the last few days and proposes a new method for stock selection and a new stock trading strategy.

papers.title: Risk-aware Regularization for Opinion-based Portfolio Selection
papers.venue: International Conference on Web and Social Media
papers.summary: This paper introduces a novel opinion-based portfolio selection task, and proposes new objective functions presenting different risk appetites of investors.

papers.title: Stock Market Analysis with Text Data: A Review
papers.summary: The aim of this study is to survey the main stock market analysis models, text representation techniques for financial market prediction, shortcomings of existing techniques, and propose promising directions for future research.

papers.title: Learning Multiple Stock Trading Patterns with Temporal Routing Adaptor and Optimal Transport
papers.summary: A novel architecture, Temporal Routing Adaptor (TRA), is proposed to empower existing stock prediction models with the ability to model multiple stock trading patterns and design a learning algorithm based on Optimal Transport to obtain the optimal sample to predictor assignment and effectively optimize the router with such assignment through an auxiliary loss term.

papers.title: Retrieving Implicit Information for Stock Movement Prediction
papers.venue: Annual International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval
papers.summary: A neural network framework that jointly learns with a news selection mechanism to extract implicit information from the chaotic daily news pool and takes advantage of neural representation learning and collaborative filtering to capture the relationship between stocks and news is developed.

papers.title: Stock Movement Prediction with Financial News using Contextualized Embedding from BERT
papers.summary: This paper introduces a new text mining method called Fine-Tuned Contextualized-Embedding Recurrent Neural Network (FT-CE-RNN), which uses contextualized vector representations of the headlines (contextualized embeddings) generated from Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT).

papers.title: Quantifying the effects of long-term news on stock markets on the basis of the multikernel Hawkes process
papers.authors: Xiao Ding,Jihao Shi,Junwen Duan,Bing Qin,Ting Liu
papers.summary: A novel multikernel-powered Hawkes process framework is proposed, which uses multiple kernels to model different time-decaying rates, thus alleviating the instability of the proposed Hawke process based prediction model.

papers.title: Accurate Multivariate Stock Movement Prediction via Data-Axis Transformer with Multi-Level Contexts
papers.summary: This work proposes DTML (Data-axis Transformer with Multi-Level contexts), a novel approach for stock movement prediction that learns the correlations between stocks in an end-to-end way and achieves the state-of-the-art accuracy on six datasets collected from various stock markets from US, China, Japan, and UK.

papers.title: Reinforcement Learning for Quantitative Trading
papers.venue: ACM Transactions on Intelligent Systems and Technology
papers.summary: A taxonomy of RL-based QT models is devised, along with a comprehensive summary of the state of the art, and current challenges and proposed future research directions in this exciting field are discussed.

papers.title: SENTiVENT: enabling supervised information extraction of company-specific events in economic and financial news
papers.summary: This work fills a large need for a manually annotated dataset for economic and financial text mining applications and produces a gold-standard dataset annotated with event triggers, participant arguments, event co-reference, and event attributes such as type, subtype, negation, and modality.

papers.title: HIST: A Graph-based Framework for Stock Trend Forecasting via Mining Concept-Oriented Shared Information
papers.authors: Wentao Xu,Weiqing Liu,Lewen Wang,Yingce Xia,Jiang Bian,Jian Yin,Tie-Yan Liu
papers.summary: A novel stock trend forecasting framework that can adequately mine the concept-oriented shared information from predefined concepts and hidden concepts is proposed that can achieve a higher investment return than the baselines.

papers.title: A review of natural language processing for financial technology
papers.authors: Ruizhuo Gao,Zeqi Zhang,Zhenning Shi,Dan Xu,Weijuan Zhang,Dewei Zhu
papers.summary: This review first introduces the development of natural language processing, and then summarizes their applications in financial technology, which mainly focuses on public opinion analysis, financial prediction and analysis, risk assessment, intelligent question answering, and automatic document generation.

papers.title: Time horizon-aware modeling of financial texts for stock price prediction
papers.venue: International Conference on AI in Finance
papers.authors: Fuli Feng,Xiang Wang,Xiangnan He,Ritchie Ng,Tat-seng Chua
papers.summary: This work proposes a new prediction solution, termed FreqNet, which explicitly associates texts with trading patterns in different frequencies, and is able to adaptively infer the time horizon of each text without labeled data on time horizon.

papers.title: DeepScalper: A Risk-Aware Reinforcement Learning Framework to Capture Fleeting Intraday Trading Opportunities
papers.venue: International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management
papers.authors: Shuo Sun,Xu He,R. Wang,Junlei Zhu,Jian Li,Bo An
papers.summary: DeepScalper is proposed, a deep reinforcement learning framework for intraday trading that significantly outperforms many state-of-the-art baselines in terms of four financial criteria.

papers.title: Stock movement prediction via gated recurrent unit network based on reinforcement learning with incorporated attention mechanisms
NumHTML: Numeric-Oriented Hierarchical Transformer Model for Multi-task Financial Forecasting
papers.authors: Linyi Yang,Jiazheng Li,Ruihai Dong,Yue Zhang,B. Smyth
papers.summary: A numeric-oriented hierarchical transformer model (NumHTML) to predict stock returns, and financial risk using multi-modal aligned earnings calls data by taking advantage of the different categories of numbers and their magnitude.

papers.title: An Exploratory Study of Stock Price Movements from Earnings Calls
papers.summary: The statistical relationship between earnings calls, company sales, stock performance, and analysts‚Äô recommendations is studied and the semantic features of transcripts are more predictive of stock price movements than sales and earnings per share.

papers.summary: A news categorization scheme is proposed to filter out and categorize news headlines related to Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX) using negligible manual effort and natural language processing based technique is used to extract context of seed keyword from initially filtered news headlines.

papers.title: An Adaptive Master-Slave Regularized Model for Unexpected Revenue Prediction Enhanced with Alternative Data
papers.venue: IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering
papers.authors: Jin Xu,Jingbo Zhou,Yongpo Jia,Jian Li,Hui Xiong
papers.summary: This paper proposed an adaptive master-slave regularized model, called AMS, to effectively leverage alternative data for unexpected revenue prediction and has demonstrated the effectiveness of the model against a set of competitors.

papers.title: Incorporating Expert-Based Investment Opinion Signals in Stock Prediction: A Deep Learning Framework
papers.summary: A novel framework which includes a stance detection model named MFN, which learns the representation of each review by integrating multi-view textual features and extended knowledge in financial domain to distill bullish/bearish investment opinions, and can effectively improve the performance of both investment opinion mining and individual stock forecasting.

papers.title: On the predictability of U.S. stock market using machine learning and deep learning techniques
papers.summary: The techniques are proven to be robust both statistically and economically when forecasting the equity premium out-of-sample using recursive window method and overall, the deep learning techniques produced the best result in this thesis.

papers.title: Feature Transformation and Simulation of Short Term Price Variability in Reinforcement Learning for Portfolio Management
papers.summary: Two automatic feature transformation techniques - Bayesian recurrent neural network (BRNN) and GANs for modelling short-term realistic price variability are able to improve the performance of reinforcement learning agents in solving portfolio management problem effectively, when measured in terms of increasing profitability and reducing risks.

papers.title: ESG2Risk: A Deep Learning Framework from ESG News to Stock Volatility Prediction
papers.authors: Tian Guo,N. Jamet,Valentin Betrix,Louis-Alexandre Piquet,E. Hauptmann
papers.summary: Experimental evaluation of the proposed pipeline of ESG news extraction, news representations, and Bayesian inference of deep learning models demonstrates the superior predicting performance as well as the relation of high volatility prediction to stocks with potential high risk and low return.

papers.title: A Novel Distributed Representation of News (DRNews) for Stock Market Predictions
papers.summary: The attention mechanism suggests that short-term stock trend and stock market crises both receive influences from daily news with the former demonstrates more critical responses on the information related to the stock market, whilst the latter draws more concerns on the banking sector and economic policies.

papers.title: Research on Stock Prediction Model Based on Deep Learning
papers.authors: Haiying Zhang,Qiaomei Liang,Siheng Li,Rongqi Wang,Qingqiang Wu
papers.summary: The L STM model with Encoder-Decoder mode and a hybridized framework of LSTM with CNN are built to improve the original model and establish a quantitative model with higher prediction accuracy.

papers.title: A hybrid two-stage financial stock forecasting algorithm based on clustering and ensemble learning
papers.summary: A hybrid prediction model, which combines both the k-means clustering and ensemble learning, has been proposed, and the experimental results demonstrate that the hybrid Prediction model obtains the best predicting accuracy of the stock price.

papers.title: Dancing with Trump in the Stock Market
papers.venue: ACM Transactions on Intelligent Systems and Technology
papers.summary: This article has found that the echoing reinforced effect of financial news with Trump‚Äôs market-related tweets can influence the market movement and proposes a deep information echoing model to predict the hourly stock market trend, such as the rise and fall of the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

papers.title: Temporally Correlated Task Scheduling for Sequence Learning
papers.authors: Xueqing Wu,Lewen Wang,Yingce Xia,Weiqing Liu,Lijun Wu,Shufang Xie,Tao Qin,Tie-Yan Liu
papers.summary: A learnable scheduler to sequence learning is introduced, which can adaptively select auxiliary tasks for training depending on the model status and the current training data, and significantly improves the performance of simultaneous machine translation and stock trend forecasting.

papers.title: A novel ensemble deep learning model for stock prediction based on stock prices and news
papers.venue: International Journal of Data Science and Analysis
papers.summary: The purpose of this work is to explain the design philosophy and show that ensemble deep learning technologies can truly predict future stock price trends more effectively and can better assist investors in making the right investment decision than other traditional methods.

papers.title: Multistep-Ahead Stock Price Forecasting Based on Secondary Decomposition Technique and Extreme Learning Machine Optimized by the Differential Evolution Algorithm
papers.authors: Zhenpeng Tang,Tingting Zhang,Junchuan Wu,Xiaoxu Du,Kaijie Chen
papers.summary: The empirical results show that the hybrid model proposed in this paper achieves the best prediction performance in all prediction scenarios, which indicates that the modeling idea focusing on the residual term effectively improves the prediction performance of the model.

papers.title: Stock movement predictive network via incorporative attention mechanisms based on tweet and historical prices
papers.summary: The core innovation is that the incorporative attention combines local and contextual attention mechanisms to clean the contextual embeddings by using local semantics, which effectively reduce the noises in the constructed higher-level representations and enhance the performance.

papers.title: RGBSticks : A New Deep Learning Based Framework for Stock Market Analysis and Prediction
papers.summary: A novel intuitive graphical representation for daily stock prices is presented, which is referred as RGBSticks, a variation of classical candle sticks, which allows the usage of complex deep learning based techniques to produce insightful visualizations for market‚Äôs past and future states.

papers.title: Incorporating stock prices and news sentiments for stock market prediction: A case of Hong Kong
papers.summary: This paper builds up a stock prediction system and proposes an approach that represents numerical price data by technical indicators via technical analysis, and represents textual news articles by sentiment vectors via sentiment analysis, which outperforms the baselines in both validation and test sets using two different evaluation metrics.
